bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edgar Mayer, March 4, 1943

div1.p: Hench informs Mayer that his wife just gave birth to their baby and so he will spend some time at home.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edgar Mayer, March 4, 1943
div1.opener:
STATION HOSPITAL
Camp Carson, Colorado
March 4, 1943
Dr. Edgar Mayer
Four Seventy Park Avenue
New York, New York
My dear Dr. Mayer:
div1.p:
I appreciate indeed your additional letter of February 18.
I have heard nothing from Dr. Fishbein except his initial letter.
I don't know whether or not he has done anything to try to get me
to New York on March 16. As a matter of fact, a family crisis has
just arisen which will make it impossible for me to be there on
that day. My wife was to have presented me with a baby on March 13,
but the baby was born here last week. My wife and the baby are
doing splendidly and we are taking the baby home on March 12, and
you can understand my personal desire to be there throughout my ten
day leave. The Army is very strict about giving leaves, and wherewere
I to come to New York as part of my personal leave, I would lose
that week of being home. We are only allowed about a month a year,
and guard the days very jealously so that we can get home about ten
days three times a year. Those officers who do not have their fam-
ilies with them hate very much to have anything interfere with the
precious days with their families.

Of course, if the Surgeon General's Office ordered me to
any medical meeting, I would be allowed to got without using my per-
sonal leave time. I wonder if the Surgeon General's Department would
be willing to order me to such a medical meeting. If there is a
later meeting of the Institute, I could request detached service to
attend this meeting. I would have to pay my own way, but the time
would not be counted against me. If the Army would not order me
there, I would be glad to come on my own if it could be done as de-
tached service. When is the next meeting after the March 16th
meeting?
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. HENCH
Lieut Colonel, M.C. PSH:RA
